questions.questionText: 1.Select the correct code which indicates the basic elements which leads the entire process of research.
2.Research process intended to find out ultimate beneficiary of law is –
3.What is the aim of the Collative Model?

options.text: To find out the attitude, responsiveness and reactivity of society
To compare two or more laws and to rule out the batter and relevant one
To find out the ultimate beneficiary of any law
To ascertain the nature, scope and sources of law

questions.questionText: 4.Interactive legal research focuses to –

options.text: Find out the factors showing an Interaction of researcher with the research
Study the interaction between relevant and irrelevant variables
Find out the facts evidencing interaction of social factors with the law

questions.questionText: 5.The research follows to study the impact of legal principle, rule or institution on society on the society is called as:
6.An ontological claim means that:

options.text: There is a reality, existing independently  of the human min
That reality may be known by the human min
To check the truth in changing social demands.
To find out  the lacuna in existing social norms.

questions.questionText: 7.Every research action has a quest of knowledge which is known as –
8.What is necessary  to get accurate, true and reliable outcomes of any research?
9.The research which demonstrates the cause and effect relationship between the variables by manipulating them is called –
10.The research is –

options.text: A voyage from known facts to unknown facts

questions.questionText: 11.The objective of legal research is to:

options.text: Finding out the objectives of existing law and customs.
To check their utility in changing social demands.
To find out lacuna, if any,  and to take steps to overcome it.

questions.questionText: 12.Select the correct order of data processing.

options.text: Collection of Data – Interpretation of Data –  Analysis of Dat
Collection of Data – Analysis of Data – Interpretation of Dat
Analysis of Data – Interpretation of Data – Collection of Dat
Analysis of Data – Collection of Data– Interpretation of Dat

questions.questionText: 13. Objectivism’ means –

options.text: A conscientious judgment without internal or external biasness

options.text: Remedies for eradication and control of problem
